secondaryIdInfos.domain: Fred Hutch/University of Washington Cancer Consortium

identificationModule.briefTitle: Sustained Oral Fiber Supplementation for Patients Undergoing Donor Stem Cell Transplantation for Hematological Malignancies
identificationModule.officialTitle: Feasibility of Implementing Sustained Oral Fiber Supplementation for Patients Undergoing Allogeneic Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation for Hematological Malignancies

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This clinical trial examines sustained oral fiber supplementation for patients undergoing donor stem cell transplantation for hematological malignancies. Patients undergoing donor stem cell transplantation often develop oral and gastrointestinal damage from chemotherapy, radiotherapy, or graft-versus-host disease. Oral fiber nutrition support may improve overall nutrition, support a normal gut microbiome (bacteria that live in the gut) and/or improve gut function in patients undergoing stem cell transplants.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
OUTLINE:

Current study design: Patients receive fiber supplementation orally (PO) or enterally starting 14 days prior to day 1 of conditioning chemotherapy and continuing until discharge Patients who are not able to receive sufficient nutrition by mouth may receive parenteral nutrition or enteral nutrition by feeding tube from the hospital. Patients may undergo blood sample collection throughout the study.

Previous study design: Before this study was amended in January 2024, patients were randomized to 1 of 2 arms.

Previous Arm I: Patients received enteral nutrition via nasoenteric feeding tube starting on day 1 until hospital discharge.

Previous Arm II: Patients received standard of care nutritional support.

armGroups.label: Arm I (enteral nutrition) [Discontinued in January 2024]
armGroups.description: Patients receive enteral nutrition via nasoenteric feeding tube starting on day 1 until hospital discharge.

armGroups.label: Arm II (standard of care) [Discontinued in January 2024]
armGroups.description: Patients receive standard of care nutritional support.
interventionNames: Dietary Supplement: Standard of Care Nutritional Support

armGroups.label: Supportive care (Fiber) [Current study activity]
armGroups.description: Patients receive fiber supplementation PO or enterally starting 14 days prior to day 1 of conditioning chemotherapy and continuing until discharge from the hospital. Stool will be collected at different time points throughout the study. Patients may also undergo blood sample collection throughout the study.

interventions.name: Kate Farms 1.0
interventions.description: Given enteral nutrition via nasoenteric feeding

interventions.name: Standard of Care Nutritional Support
interventions.description: Given standard of care, which may be parenteral nutrition
armGroupLabels: Arm II (standard of care) [Discontinued in January 2024]

interventions.name: Survey Administration
armGroupLabels: Arm II (standard of care) [Discontinued in January 2024]

interventions.name: Dietary Supplement
interventions.description: Receive fiber supplementation orally or enterally

interventions.name: Biospecimen Collection
interventions.description: Undergo collection of blood and stool samples

primaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of eligible patients who consent to enroll in the study will be computed based on the number approached and estimated with 95% confidence intervals.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of days receiving at least 10 grams of fiber
Number of days receiving at least 25 grams of fiber
Tolerance of initiating and maintaining oral fiber intake
secondaryOutcomes.description: Tolerance of initiating and maintaining oral fiber intake (or via enteral nutrition) will be calculated as delivery of the intended amount on each day that nutritional supplementation was indicated.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Level of comfort/distress attributed to initiating and maintaining oral fiber intake
secondaryOutcomes.description: The post-discharge questions measuring level of comfort or distress experienced with each nutritional treatment will be tabulated.
Will assess safety including diarrhea, abdominal pain, bloating.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Able to provide written informed consent prior to initiation of any study procedures
* Planned allogeneic stem cell transplantation with planned hospital admission for transplant
* At least 18 years of age

Exclusion Criteria:

* Major psychiatric diagnosis that impairs cognitive functioning or is not controlled at the time of the approach, as judged by the patient's medical team
* Pregnant or breastfeeding. Pregnancy test is obtained as part of pre-transplant evaluation in women of child-bearing potential at arrival to transplant and again within 7 days of conditioning and will be confirmed as negative by review of the chart
